metadata.description: Specifies the address prefixes of the virtual network.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet hosting the system node pool of the AKS cluster.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet which contains the Application Gateway.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet which contains the virtual machine.
Specifies the NetApp File subnet IP prefix. This prefix must be within vnet IP prefix address space.
The CIDR IP range that is permitted to access the bastion instances. We recommend that you set this value to a trusted IP range.
Specifies the version of Kubernetes specified when creating the managed cluster.
Specifies whether to create the cluster as a private cluster or not.
Specifies the tier of a managed cluster SKU: Paid or Free
Specifies the vm size of nodes in the system node pool.
Specifies the vm size of nodes in the user node pool.
Specifies the tags of the AKS cluster.
Specifies the CIDR notation IP range from which to assign pod IPs when kubenet is used.
A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign service cluster IPs. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges.
Specifies the IP address assigned to the Kubernetes DNS service. It must be within the Kubernetes service address range specified in serviceCidr.
Specifies the CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge network. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges or the Kubernetes service address range.
Specifies whether enabling AAD integration.
Specifies whether to enable managed AAD integration.
Specifies whether to  to enable Azure RBAC for Kubernetes authorization.
Specifies the number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers in the system node pool. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive). The default value is 1.
Specifies the minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling for the system node pool.
Specifies the maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling for the system node pool.
Specifies the availability zones for the agent nodes in the system node pool. Requirese the use of VirtualMachineScaleSets as node pool type.
Specifies the number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers in the user node pool. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive). The default value is 1.
Specifies the minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling for the user node pool.
Specifies the maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling for the user node pool.
Specifies Pod limit CPU Size
Specifies Pod limit Memory Size
Specifies persistent volume size
Target performance for the capacity pool. Service level: Ultra, Premium, or Standard.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of the administrator account of the virtual machine.
Specifies the password for the virtual machine.
Boomi Platform Authentication Type
The Boomi account ID that you want to associate with the new Molecule cluster.
The email account associated with the Boomi account.
An MFA API token generated by your Boomi Administrator.
The password associated with the Boomi account.
The Boomi Molecule cluster name
Location
The base Url for dependent assets

The sasToken required to access _artifactsLocation.  When the template is deployed using the accompanying scripts, a sasToken will be automatically generated. Use the defaultValue if the staging location is not secured.

resources.comments: User-Defined Managed Identity defined for the AKS cluster. Used to access the Virtual Network and other resources.
resources.name: [variables('aksClusterUserDefinedManagedIdentityName')]

resources.comments: User-Defined Managed Identity used by the Application Gateway is assigned. Used to access Azure Key Vault.
resources.name: [variables('applicationGatewayUserDefinedManagedIdentityName')]

resources.comments: User-Defined Managed Identity used by an AAD Pod Identity. Used to access Azure Key Vault.
resources.name: [variables('aadPodIdentityUserDefinedManagedIdentityName')]

resources.comments: User-Defined Managed Identity defined for the Azure Virtual Machine. Used to access the Virtual Network and other resources.
resources.name: [variables('virtualMachineUserDefinedManagedIdentityName')]

properties.description: Assign the cluster user-defined managed identity contributor role on the resource group.

resources.comments: Grant the AKS cluster ingress controller pod managed identity with reader role permissions over Key Vault; paired with the Access Policy, this allows our ingress controller to pull certificates.
resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(concat(resourceGroup().id), variables('readerRoleId')))]

protectedSettings.commandToExecute: [concat('./k8s_deployment.sh',' --resource_group "',resourceGroup().name, '" --appgw_ssl_cert "', variables('applicationGatewaySSLCert'),'" --aks_name "', variables('aksClusterName'), '" --boomi_auth "', parameters('BoomiAuthenticationType'), '" --boomi_token "', parameters('BoomiMFAAPIToken'), '" --boomi_username "',parameters('BoomiUsername'), '" --boomi_password "', parameters('BoomiPassword'), '" --boomi_account "', parameters('BoomiAccountID'),'" --boomi_molecule_name "', parameters('BoomiMoleculeName'), '" --fileshare "', variables('netAppVolumeName'),'" --pod_cpu "', parameters('PodCPUSize'),'" --pod_memory "',parameters('PodMemorySize'),'" --pv_size "',parameters('PersistentVolumeSize'),'" --netAppIP "', reference(resourceId('Microsoft.NetApp/netAppAccounts/capacityPools/volumes/',variables('netAppAccountName'), variables('netAppPoolName'), variables('netAppVolumeName'))).mountTargets[0].ipAddress,'"')]
